From: "Ko, Lauren" <lauren.ko@...>

Yes, Heritrix can perform that crawl. You can read about configuring scope =
for a crawl here: https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Configu=
ring+Crawl+Scope+Using+DecideRules. In particular, you could use the Matche=
sRegexDecideRule or MatchesListRegexDecideRule to look for the keyword in y=
our URLs.

Lauren Ko
UNT Libraries
________________________________________=

From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com [archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com]
Se=
nt: Sunday, June 19, 2016 11:13 AM
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subj=
ect: [archive-crawler] Newbie has question

Can Heritrix be used to perform=
 the following crawl:

User needs to search a list of URL such as: www.firs=
tdomain.com<http://www.firstcomain.com> and www.seconddomain.com<http://www=
.seconddomain.com>



etc. etc. for URLs that have a specific keyword such =
as in the following example:

www.firstdomain.com/looking-for-this-keyword<=
http://www.firstdomain.com/looking-for-this-keyword>
www.seconddomain.com/l=
ooking-for-this-keyword<http://www.seconddomain.com/looingfor>

The keyword=
 is always the same among all the domains searched and may have other words=
 before and after it, but if the keyword is present in the URL, capture the=
 URL and save, otherwise, go onto the next URL in the list.

thank you!
